verses.original: In the beginning, God created the heavens and the earth.
verses.korean: 맨 처음에 하나님께서 하늘과 땅을 만드셨어요.

verses.original: The earth was formless and empty. Darkness was on the surface of the deep and God's Spirit was hovering over the surface of the waters.
verses.korean: 그때 땅에는 아무것도 없었고, 깜깜한 어둠만 가득했어요. 하나님의 영이 물 위를 움직이고 계셨어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let there be light," and there was light.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "빛이 생겨라!" 하고 말씀하시자, 빛이 생겼어요.

verses.original: God saw the light, and saw that it was good. God divided the light from the darkness.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 빛을 보시고 참 좋다고 생각하셨어요. 그리고 빛과 어둠을 나누셨어요.

verses.original: God called the light "day", and the darkness he called "night". There was evening and there was morning, the first day.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 빛을 "낮"이라고 부르시고, 어둠을 "밤"이라고 부르셨어요. 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 이것이 첫째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let there be an expanse in the middle of the waters, and let it divide the waters from the waters."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "물 사이에 하늘이 생겨서 물을 위아래로 나누어라!" 하고 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: God made the expanse, and divided the waters which were under the expanse from the waters which were above the expanse; and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 하늘을 만드시고, 하늘 아래 물과 하늘 위 물을 나누셨어요. 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God called the expanse "sky". There was evening and there was morning, a second day.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 이것을 "하늘"이라고 부르셨어요. 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 둘째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the waters under the sky be gathered together to one place, and let the dry land appear;" and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "하늘 아래 물은 한곳에 모이고, 마른 땅이 나타나라!" 하고 말씀하시자 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God called the dry land "earth", and the gathering together of the waters he called "seas". God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 마른 땅을 "땅"이라 부르시고, 모인 물을 "바다"라고 부르셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the earth yield grass, herbs yielding seeds, and fruit trees bearing fruit after their kind, with their seeds in it, on the earth;" and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "땅에서 풀과 씨 맺는 채소와 열매 맺는 나무들이 자라나라!" 하고 말씀하시자 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: The earth yielded grass, herbs yielding seed after their kind, and trees bearing fruit, with their seeds in it, after their kind; and God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 땅에서 풀과 씨 맺는 채소와 열매 맺는 나무가 자라났어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: There was evening and there was morning, a third day.
verses.korean: 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 셋째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let there be lights in the expanse of the sky to divide the day from the night; and let them be for signs to mark seasons, days, and years;
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "하늘에 빛들이 생겨서 낮과 밤을 나누고, 계절과 날과 해를 알려 주어라!" 하고 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: and let them be for lights in the expanse of the sky to give light on the earth;" and it was so.
verses.korean: "그 빛들이 땅을 비추어라!" 하시니 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God made the two great lights: the greater light to rule the day, and the lesser light to rule the night. He also made the stars.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 두 개의 큰 빛을 만드셨어요. 큰 빛은 낮을 다스리는 해이고, 작은 빛은 밤을 다스리는 달이에요. 별들도 만드셨어요.

verses.original: God set them in the expanse of the sky to give light to the earth,
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그것들을 하늘에 두시어 땅을 비추게 하셨어요.

verses.original: and to rule over the day and over the night, and to divide the light from the darkness. God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 낮과 밤을 다스리고 빛과 어둠을 나누게 하셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: There was evening and there was morning, a fourth day.
verses.korean: 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 넷째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the waters abound with living creatures, and let birds fly above the earth in the open expanse of the sky."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "물에는 생물이 가득하고, 하늘에는 새들이 날아다녀라!" 하고 말씀하셨어요.

verses.original: God created the large sea creatures and every living creature that moves, with which the waters swarmed, after their kind, and every winged bird after its kind. God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 큰 바다 동물들과 물에서 사는 모든 생물들, 그리고 날개 달린 새들을 만드셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: God blessed them, saying, "Be fruitful, and multiply, and fill the waters in the seas, and let birds multiply on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그들에게 복을 주시며 말씀하셨어요. "많이 낳고 번성해서 바다와 땅을 가득 채워라!"

verses.original: There was evening and there was morning, a fifth day.
verses.korean: 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 다섯째 날이었어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let the earth produce living creatures after their kind, livestock, creeping things, and animals of the earth after their kind;" and it was so.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 "땅에서 생물이 나와라! 가축과 기어 다니는 것과 들짐승이 나와라!" 하시니 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God made the animals of the earth after their kind, and the livestock after their kind, and everything that creeps on the ground after its kind. God saw that it was good.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 들짐승과 가축과 기어 다니는 모든 것을 만드셨어요. 하나님께서 보시니 참 좋았어요.

verses.original: God said, "Let's make man in our image, after our likeness. Let them have dominion over the fish of the sea, and over the birds of the sky, and over the livestock, and over all the earth, and over every creeping thing that creeps on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "우리의 모습을 닮은 사람을 만들자. 사람이 바다의 물고기와 하늘의 새와 가축과 온 땅과 기어 다니는 모든 것을 돌보게 하자."

verses.original: God created man in his own image. In God's image he created him; male and female he created them.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 자기 모습을 닮은 사람을 만드셨어요. 하나님의 모습대로 사람을 만드시되, 남자와 여자로 만드셨어요.

verses.original: God blessed them. God said to them, "Be fruitful, multiply, fill the earth, and subdue it. Have dominion over the fish of the sea, over the birds of the sky, and over every living thing that moves on the earth."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그들에게 복을 주시며 말씀하셨어요. "많이 낳고 번성해서 땅을 가득 채워라. 바다의 물고기와 하늘의 새와 땅의 모든 생물을 잘 돌보아라."

verses.original: God said, "Behold, I have given you every herb yielding seed, which is on the surface of all the earth, and every tree, which bears fruit yielding seed. It will be your food.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "보아라, 내가 씨 맺는 모든 채소와 열매 맺는 모든 나무를 너희에게 주었으니, 이것이 너희 음식이 될 것이다."

verses.original: To every animal of the earth, and to every bird of the sky, and to everything that creeps on the earth, in which there is life, I have given every green herb for food;" and it was so.
verses.korean: "땅의 모든 동물과 하늘의 새와 기어 다니는 모든 것에게는 푸른 풀을 먹이로 주었다." 그대로 되었어요.

verses.original: God saw everything that he had made, and, behold, it was very good. There was evening and there was morning, a sixth day.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 만드신 모든 것을 보시니, 정말 아주 좋았어요. 저녁이 지나고 아침이 되니, 여섯째 날이었어요.

verses.original: The heavens, the earth, and all their vast array were finished.
verses.korean: 하늘과 땅과 그 안에 있는 모든 것이 다 완성되었어요.

verses.original: On the seventh day God finished his work which he had done; and he rested on the seventh day from all his work which he had done.
verses.korean: 일곱째 날에 하나님께서 하시던 일을 마치시고 쉬셨어요.

verses.original: God blessed the seventh day, and made it holy, because he rested in it from all his work of creation which he had done.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 일곱째 날에 복을 주시고 거룩하게 하셨어요. 이 날에 모든 창조 일을 마치고 쉬셨기 때문이에요.

verses.original: This is the history of the generations of the heavens and of the earth when they were created, in the day that Yahweh God made the earth and the heavens.
verses.korean: 이것은 하나님께서 하늘과 땅을 만드신 이야기예요.

verses.original: No plant of the field was yet in the earth, and no herb of the field had yet sprung up; for Yahweh God had not caused it to rain on the earth. There was not a man to till the ground,
verses.korean: 아직 땅에는 식물도 없고 풀도 자라지 않았어요. 하나님께서 비를 내리지 않으셨고, 땅을 가꿀 사람도 없었기 때문이에요.

verses.original: but a mist went up from the earth, and watered the whole surface of the ground.
verses.korean: 하지만 안개가 땅에서 올라와 온 땅을 적셔 주었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God formed man from the dust of the ground, and breathed into his nostrils the breath of life; and man became a living soul.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 땅의 흙으로 사람을 빚으시고, 그 코에 생명의 숨을 불어넣어 주셨어요. 그래서 사람이 살아 있는 존재가 되었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God planted a garden eastward, in Eden, and there he put the man whom he had formed.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 동쪽에 있는 에덴이라는 곳에 동산을 만드시고, 그곳에 만드신 사람을 두셨어요.

verses.original: Out of the ground Yahweh God made every tree to grow that is pleasant to the sight, and good for food, including the tree of life in the middle of the garden and the tree of the knowledge of good and evil.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 땅에서 보기 좋고 먹기 좋은 나무들이 자라게 하셨어요. 동산 가운데에는 생명나무와 선과 악을 알게 하는 나무도 있었어요.

verses.original: A river went out of Eden to water the garden; and from there it was parted, and became the source of four rivers.
verses.korean: 에덴에서 강이 흘러나와 동산을 적셔 주었고, 그 강은 네 갈래로 나뉘었어요.

verses.original: The name of the first is Pishon: it flows through the whole land of Havilah, where there is gold;
verses.korean: 첫째 강의 이름은 비손이에요. 이 강은 금이 나는 하윌라 땅을 흘러요.

verses.original: and the gold of that land is good. Bdellium and onyx stone are also there.
verses.korean: 그 땅의 금은 아주 좋고, 향료와 보석도 있어요.

verses.original: The name of the second river is Gihon. It is the same river that flows through the whole land of Cush.
verses.korean: 둘째 강의 이름은 기혼이에요. 이 강은 구스 땅을 흘러요.

verses.original: The name of the third river is Hiddekel. This is the one which flows in front of Assyria. The fourth river is the Euphrates.
verses.korean: 셋째 강의 이름은 힛데겔이에요. 이 강은 앗시리아 앞을 흘러요. 넷째 강은 유프라테스예요.

verses.original: Yahweh God took the man, and put him into the garden of Eden to cultivate and keep it.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람을 에덴 동산에 두시고, 그곳을 돌보게 하셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God commanded the man, saying, "You may freely eat of every tree of the garden;
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람에게 말씀하셨어요. "동산에 있는 모든 나무의 열매는 마음껏 먹어도 좋다.

verses.original: but you shall not eat of the tree of the knowledge of good and evil; for in the day that you eat of it, you will surely die."
verses.korean: 하지만 선과 악을 알게 하는 나무의 열매는 먹지 마라. 그것을 먹으면 반드시 죽게 될 것이다."

verses.original: Yahweh God said, "It is not good for the man to be alone. I will make him a helper comparable to him."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "사람이 혼자 있는 것은 좋지 않다. 그를 도와줄 짝을 만들어 주겠다."

verses.original: Out of the ground Yahweh God formed every animal of the field, and every bird of the sky, and brought them to the man to see what he would call them. Whatever the man called every living creature became its name.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 흙으로 들짐승과 하늘의 새들을 만드시고 사람에게 데려오셔서 이름을 짓게 하셨어요. 사람이 지은 이름이 그 동물의 이름이 되었어요.

verses.original: The man gave names to all livestock, and to the birds of the sky, and to every animal of the field; but for man there was not found a helper comparable to him.
verses.korean: 사람이 모든 가축과 하늘의 새와 들짐승에게 이름을 지어 주었어요. 하지만 사람을 도와줄 짝은 찾지 못했어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God caused the man to fall into a deep sleep. As the man slept, he took one of his ribs, and closed up the flesh in its place.
verses.korean: 그래서 하나님께서 사람을 깊이 잠들게 하시고, 그의 갈비뼈 하나를 꺼내신 후 그 자리를 살로 메우셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God made a woman from the rib which he had taken from the man, and brought her to the man.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 그 갈비뼈로 여자를 만드시고 사람에게 데려오셨어요.

verses.original: The man said, "This is now bone of my bones, and flesh of my flesh. She will be called 'woman,' because she was taken out of Man."
verses.korean: 사람이 말했어요. "드디어 나왔구나! 이 사람은 내 뼈에서 나온 뼈요, 내 살에서 나온 살이다. 남자에게서 나왔으니 '여자'라고 부르겠다."

verses.original: Therefore a man will leave his father and his mother, and will join with his wife, and they will be one flesh.
verses.korean: 그래서 남자는 부모를 떠나 아내와 함께 살며, 둘이 한 몸이 되어요.

verses.original: The man and his wife were both naked, and they were not ashamed.
verses.korean: 그때 남자와 여자는 옷을 입지 않았지만 부끄러워하지 않았어요.

verses.original: Now the serpent was more subtle than any animal of the field which Yahweh God had made. He said to the woman, "Has God really said, 'You shall not eat of any tree of the garden'?"
verses.korean: 뱀은 하나님께서 만드신 들짐승 중에서 가장 교활했어요. 뱀이 여자에게 물었어요. "하나님이 정말 동산의 나무 열매를 먹지 말라고 하셨니?"

verses.original: The woman said to the serpent, "We may eat fruit from the trees of the garden,
verses.korean: 여자가 뱀에게 대답했어요. "동산에 있는 나무 열매는 먹어도 돼.

verses.original: but not the fruit of the tree which is in the middle of the garden. God has said, 'You shall not eat of it. You shall not touch it, lest you die.'"
verses.korean: 하지만 동산 가운데 있는 나무 열매만은 먹지도 만지지도 말라고 하셨어. 그러면 죽는다고 하셨거든."

verses.original: The serpent said to the woman, "You won't really die,
verses.korean: 뱀이 여자에게 말했어요. "죽지 않아.

verses.original: for God knows that in the day you eat it, your eyes will be opened, and you will be like God, knowing good and evil."
verses.korean: 하나님은 네가 그것을 먹으면 눈이 밝아져서 하나님처럼 선과 악을 알게 된다는 것을 아시거든."

verses.original: When the woman saw that the tree was good for food, and that it was a delight to the eyes, and that the tree was to be desired to make one wise, she took some of its fruit, and ate. Then she gave some to her husband with her, and he ate it, too.
verses.korean: 여자가 그 나무를 보니 열매가 맛있어 보이고, 눈에도 아름답고, 지혜로워지게 한다니 탐이 났어요. 그래서 열매를 따서 먹고, 함께 있던 남편에게도 주었어요. 남편도 그것을 먹었어요.

verses.original: Their eyes were opened, and they both knew that they were naked. They sewed fig leaves together, and made coverings for themselves.
verses.korean: 그러자 두 사람의 눈이 밝아져서 자기들이 옷을 입지 않았다는 것을 알게 되었어요. 그래서 무화과나무 잎을 엮어서 몸을 가렸어요.

verses.original: They heard Yahweh God's voice walking in the garden in the cool of the day, and the man and his wife hid themselves from the presence of Yahweh God among the trees of the garden.
verses.korean: 저녁때 시원한 바람이 불 때, 하나님께서 동산을 거니시는 소리가 들렸어요. 남자와 여자는 하나님을 피해서 나무 사이에 숨었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God called to the man, and said to him, "Where are you?"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 남자를 부르셨어요. "네가 어디 있느냐?"

verses.original: The man said, "I heard your voice in the garden, and I was afraid, because I was naked; so I hid myself."
verses.korean: 남자가 대답했어요. "동산에서 하나님의 소리를 듣고 무서웠어요. 제가 옷을 입지 않아서 숨었어요."

verses.original: God said, "Who told you that you were naked? Have you eaten from the tree that I commanded you not to eat from?"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 물으셨어요. "네가 옷을 입지 않았다는 것을 누가 알려 주었느냐? 내가 먹지 말라고 한 나무 열매를 먹었느냐?"

verses.original: The man said, "The woman whom you gave to be with me, she gave me fruit from the tree, and I ate it."
verses.korean: 남자가 대답했어요. "하나님께서 저에게 주신 이 여자가 열매를 주어서 제가 먹었어요."

verses.original: Yahweh God said to the woman, "What have you done?" The woman said, "The serpent deceived me, and I ate."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 여자에게 물으셨어요. "네가 무슨 짓을 한 것이냐?" 여자가 대답했어요. "뱀이 저를 속여서 제가 먹었어요."

verses.original: Yahweh God said to the serpent, "Because you have done this, you are cursed above all livestock, and above every animal of the field. You shall go on your belly and you shall eat dust all the days of your life.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 뱀에게 말씀하셨어요. "네가 이런 일을 했으니, 모든 짐승 중에서 너는 저주를 받을 것이다. 배로 기어 다니며 평생 흙을 먹을 것이다.

verses.original: I will put hostility between you and the woman, and between your offspring and her offspring. He will bruise your head, and you will bruise his heel."
verses.korean: 너와 여자 사이에, 네 자손과 여자의 자손 사이에 원수가 되게 하겠다. 여자의 자손이 네 머리를 밟을 것이고, 너는 그의 발꿈치를 물 것이다."

verses.original: To the woman he said, "I will greatly multiply your pain in childbirth. You will bear children in pain. Your desire will be for your husband, and he will rule over you."
verses.korean: 여자에게는 이렇게 말씀하셨어요. "네가 아이를 낳을 때 많이 아플 것이다. 고통 속에서 아이를 낳게 될 것이다."

verses.original: To Adam he said, "Because you have listened to your wife's voice, and ate from the tree, about which I commanded you, saying, 'You shall not eat of it,' the ground is cursed for your sake. You will eat from it with much labor all the days of your life.
verses.korean: 아담에게는 이렇게 말씀하셨어요. "네가 아내의 말을 듣고, 먹지 말라고 한 열매를 먹었으니, 땅이 너 때문에 저주를 받을 것이다. 평생 힘들게 일해야 먹을 것을 얻을 것이다.

verses.original: It will yield thorns and thistles to you; and you will eat the herb of the field.
verses.korean: 땅에서 가시덤불과 엉겅퀴가 날 것이고, 들의 채소를 먹을 것이다.

verses.original: You will eat bread by the sweat of your face until you return to the ground, for you were taken out of it. For you are dust, and you shall return to dust."
verses.korean: 땀을 흘리며 힘들게 일해야 빵을 먹을 수 있을 것이다. 결국 네가 나온 땅으로 돌아갈 것이다. 너는 흙에서 왔으니 다시 흙으로 돌아갈 것이다."

verses.original: The man called his wife Eve because she would be the mother of all the living.
verses.korean: 아담은 아내의 이름을 '하와'라고 지었어요. 하와는 모든 살아 있는 사람의 어머니가 될 것이기 때문이에요.

verses.original: Yahweh God made garments of animal skins for Adam and for his wife, and clothed them.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 아담과 그의 아내에게 가죽옷을 만들어 입혀 주셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh God said, "Behold, the man has become like one of us, knowing good and evil. Now, lest he reach out his hand, and also take of the tree of life, and eat, and live forever—"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "보아라, 사람이 선과 악을 알게 되어 우리처럼 되었다. 이제 생명나무 열매까지 따서 먹고 영원히 살게 해서는 안 된다."

verses.original: Therefore Yahweh God sent him out from the garden of Eden, to till the ground from which he was taken.
verses.korean: 그래서 하나님께서 아담을 에덴 동산에서 내보내시고, 그가 나온 땅을 농사짓게 하셨어요.

verses.original: So he drove out the man; and he placed cherubim at the east of the garden of Eden, and a flaming sword which turned every way, to guard the way to the tree of life.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 사람을 쫓아내시고, 에덴 동산 동쪽에 그룹 천사들과 빙빙 돌아가는 불칼을 두어 생명나무로 가는 길을 지키게 하셨어요.

verses.original: The man knew Eve his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Cain, and said, "I have gotten a man with Yahweh's help."
verses.korean: 아담과 하와 사이에서 아들이 태어났어요. 하와가 말했어요. "하나님의 도움으로 아들을 얻었어요." 그래서 이름을 가인이라고 지었어요.

verses.original: Again she gave birth, to Cain's brother Abel. Abel was a keeper of sheep, but Cain was a tiller of the ground.
verses.korean: 하와가 또 아들을 낳아 이름을 아벨이라고 지었어요. 아벨은 양을 치는 목자가 되었고, 가인은 농사를 짓는 사람이 되었어요.

verses.original: As time passed, Cain brought an offering to Yahweh from the fruit of the ground.
verses.korean: 시간이 지나서, 가인은 땅에서 거둔 곡식을 하나님께 제물로 드렸어요.

verses.original: Abel also brought some of the firstborn of his flock and of its fat. Yahweh respected Abel and his offering,
verses.korean: 아벨도 양 떼 중에서 맏배로 태어난 것과 그 기름을 드렸어요. 하나님께서는 아벨과 그의 제물을 기쁘게 받으셨어요.

verses.original: but he didn't respect Cain and his offering. Cain was very angry, and the expression on his face fell.
verses.korean: 하지만 가인과 그의 제물은 받지 않으셨어요. 가인은 매우 화가 나서 얼굴이 일그러졌어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Cain, "Why are you angry? Why has the expression of your face fallen?
verses.korean: 하나님께서 가인에게 말씀하셨어요. "왜 화가 났느냐? 왜 얼굴이 그렇게 되었느냐?

verses.original: If you do well, won't it be lifted up? If you don't do well, sin crouches at the door. Its desire is for you, but you are to rule over it."
verses.korean: 잘하면 기쁘게 받아들여질 것이다. 그러나 잘하지 못하면 죄가 문 앞에서 너를 노리고 있다. 죄가 너를 원하지만, 네가 죄를 이겨야 한다."

verses.original: Cain said to Abel, his brother, "Let's go into the field." While they were in the field, Cain rose up against Abel, his brother, and killed him.
verses.korean: 가인이 동생 아벨에게 말했어요. "들로 나가자." 들에 있을 때, 가인이 동생 아벨을 공격해서 죽였어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Cain, "Where is Abel, your brother?" He said, "I don't know. Am I my brother's keeper?"
verses.korean: 하나님께서 가인에게 물으셨어요. "네 동생 아벨이 어디 있느냐?" 가인이 대답했어요. "모릅니다. 제가 동생을 지키는 사람인가요?"

verses.original: Yahweh said, "What have you done? The voice of your brother's blood cries to me from the ground.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "네가 무슨 짓을 한 것이냐? 네 동생의 피가 땅에서 나에게 부르짖고 있다.

verses.original: Now you are cursed because of the ground, which has opened its mouth to receive your brother's blood from your hand.
verses.korean: 이제 너는 저주를 받을 것이다. 땅이 입을 벌려 네 손에서 흘린 동생의 피를 받았기 때문이다.

verses.original: From now on, when you till the ground, it won't yield its strength to you. You will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth."
verses.korean: 이제부터 네가 농사를 지어도 땅이 열매를 내지 않을 것이다. 너는 세상을 떠돌아다니는 사람이 될 것이다."

verses.original: Cain said to Yahweh, "My punishment is greater than I can bear.
verses.korean: 가인이 하나님께 말했어요. "이 벌은 제가 감당하기에 너무 큽니다.

verses.original: Behold, you have driven me out today from the surface of the ground. I will be hidden from your face, and I will be a fugitive and a wanderer in the earth. Whoever finds me will kill me."
verses.korean: 보세요, 오늘 저를 이 땅에서 쫓아내시고 하나님 앞에서 숨어야 합니다. 떠돌아다니다가 만나는 사람마다 저를 죽이려 할 것입니다."

verses.original: Yahweh said to him, "Therefore whoever slays Cain, vengeance will be taken on him sevenfold." Yahweh appointed a sign for Cain, so that anyone finding him would not strike him.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "가인을 죽이는 자는 일곱 배로 벌을 받을 것이다." 하나님께서 가인에게 표를 주셔서 누구도 그를 죽이지 못하게 하셨어요.

verses.original: Cain left Yahweh's presence, and lived in the land of Nod, east of Eden.
verses.korean: 가인은 하나님 앞을 떠나서 에덴 동쪽 놋 땅에 살았어요.

verses.original: Cain knew his wife. She conceived, and gave birth to Enoch. He built a city, and named the city after the name of his son, Enoch.
verses.korean: 가인과 그의 아내 사이에서 에녹이 태어났어요. 가인은 성을 쌓고 아들의 이름을 따서 에녹이라고 불렀어요.

verses.original: Irad was born to Enoch. Irad became the father of Mehujael. Mehujael became the father of Methushael. Methushael became the father of Lamech.
verses.korean: 에녹에게서 이랏이, 이랏에게서 므후야엘이, 므후야엘에게서 므드사엘이, 므드사엘에게서 라멕이 태어났어요.

verses.original: Lamech took two wives: the name of the first one was Adah, and the name of the second one was Zillah.
verses.korean: 라멕은 두 아내를 맞이했어요. 한 명은 아다이고, 다른 한 명은 씰라예요.

verses.original: Adah gave birth to Jabal, who was the father of those who dwell in tents and have livestock.
verses.korean: 아다에게서 야발이 태어났어요. 야발은 천막에서 살며 가축을 기르는 사람들의 조상이 되었어요.

verses.original: His brother's name was Jubal, who was the father of all who handle the harp and pipe.
verses.korean: 야발의 동생 이름은 유발이에요. 유발은 수금과 피리를 연주하는 사람들의 조상이 되었어요.

verses.original: Zillah also gave birth to Tubal Cain, the forger of every cutting instrument of bronze and iron. Tubal Cain's sister was Naamah.
verses.korean: 씰라에게서도 두발가인이 태어났어요. 두발가인은 청동과 철로 연장을 만드는 사람이었어요. 두발가인의 여동생은 나아마예요.

verses.original: Lamech said to his wives, "Adah and Zillah, hear my voice. You wives of Lamech, listen to my speech, for I have slain a man for wounding me, a young man for bruising me.
verses.korean: 라멕이 아내들에게 말했어요. "아다와 씰라야, 내 말을 들어라. 나를 다치게 한 사람을 죽였고, 나를 때린 젊은이를 죽였다.

verses.original: If Cain will be avenged seven times, truly Lamech seventy-seven times."
verses.korean: 가인을 죽이면 일곱 배로 갚는다면, 라멕을 죽이면 일흔일곱 배로 갚을 것이다."

verses.original: Adam knew his wife again. She gave birth to a son, and named him Seth, saying, "for God has given me another child instead of Abel, for Cain killed him."
verses.korean: 아담과 하와 사이에서 또 아들이 태어났어요. 하와가 말했어요. "하나님께서 가인이 죽인 아벨 대신 다른 아들을 주셨어요." 그래서 이름을 셋이라고 지었어요.

verses.original: A son was also born to Seth, and he named him Enosh. At that time men began to call on Yahweh's name.
verses.korean: 셋에게도 아들이 태어났고, 이름을 에노스라고 지었어요. 그때부터 사람들이 하나님의 이름을 부르기 시작했어요.

verses.original: This is the book of the generations of Adam. In the day that God created man, he made him in God's likeness.
verses.korean: 이것은 아담의 자손들에 대한 이야기예요. 하나님께서 사람을 만드실 때, 하나님의 모습을 닮게 만드셨어요.

verses.original: He created them male and female, and blessed them. On the day they were created, he named them Adam.
verses.korean: 남자와 여자로 만드시고 복을 주셨어요. 만드신 날에 그들을 '아담'이라고 부르셨어요.

verses.original: Adam lived one hundred thirty years, and became the father of a son in his own likeness, after his image, and named him Seth.
verses.korean: 아담은 130살에 자기를 닮은 아들을 낳고 셋이라고 이름 지었어요.

verses.original: The days of Adam after he became the father of Seth were eight hundred years, and he became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 셋을 낳은 후 아담은 800년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days that Adam lived were nine hundred thirty years, then he died.
verses.korean: 아담은 모두 930살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Seth lived one hundred five years, then became the father of Enosh.
verses.korean: 셋은 105살에 에노스를 낳았어요.

verses.original: Seth lived after he became the father of Enosh eight hundred seven years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 에노스를 낳은 후 807년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Seth were nine hundred twelve years, then he died.
verses.korean: 셋은 모두 912살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Enosh lived ninety years, and became the father of Kenan.
verses.korean: 에노스는 90살에 게난을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Enosh lived after he became the father of Kenan eight hundred fifteen years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 게난을 낳은 후 815년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Enosh were nine hundred five years, then he died.
verses.korean: 에노스는 모두 905살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Kenan lived seventy years, then became the father of Mahalalel.
verses.korean: 게난은 70살에 마할랄렐을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Kenan lived after he became the father of Mahalalel eight hundred forty years, and became the father of other sons and daughters
verses.korean: 마할랄렐을 낳은 후 840년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: and all of the days of Kenan were nine hundred ten years, then he died.
verses.korean: 게난은 모두 910살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Mahalalel lived sixty-five years, then became the father of Jared.
verses.korean: 마할랄렐은 65살에 야렛을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Mahalalel lived after he became the father of Jared eight hundred thirty years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 야렛을 낳은 후 830년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Mahalalel were eight hundred ninety-five years, then he died.
verses.korean: 마할랄렐은 모두 895살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Jared lived one hundred sixty-two years, then became the father of Enoch.
verses.korean: 야렛은 162살에 에녹을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Jared lived after he became the father of Enoch eight hundred years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 에녹을 낳은 후 800년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All of the days of Jared were nine hundred sixty-two years, then he died.
verses.korean: 야렛은 모두 962살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Enoch lived sixty-five years, then became the father of Methuselah.
verses.korean: 에녹은 65살에 므두셀라를 낳았어요.

verses.original: After Methuselah's birth, Enoch walked with God for three hundred years, and became the father of more sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 므두셀라를 낳은 후 에녹은 300년 동안 하나님과 함께 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Enoch were three hundred sixty-five years.
verses.korean: 에녹은 모두 365살을 살았어요.

verses.original: Enoch walked with God, and he was not found, for God took him.
verses.korean: 에녹은 하나님과 함께 살았는데, 어느 날 사라졌어요. 하나님께서 그를 데려가셨기 때문이에요.

verses.original: Methuselah lived one hundred eighty-seven years, then became the father of Lamech.
verses.korean: 므두셀라는 187살에 라멕을 낳았어요.

verses.original: Methuselah lived after he became the father of Lamech seven hundred eighty-two years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 라멕을 낳은 후 782년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Methuselah were nine hundred sixty-nine years, then he died.
verses.korean: 므두셀라는 모두 969살을 살다가 죽었어요. 성경에서 가장 오래 산 사람이에요!

verses.original: Lamech lived one hundred eighty-two years, then became the father of a son.
verses.korean: 라멕은 182살에 아들을 낳았어요.

verses.original: He named him Noah, saying, "This one will comfort us in our work and in the toil of our hands, caused by the ground which Yahweh has cursed."
verses.korean: 그 아들의 이름을 노아라고 지으며 말했어요. "하나님께서 저주하신 땅에서 힘들게 일하는 우리를 이 아이가 위로해 줄 것이다."

verses.original: Lamech lived after he became the father of Noah five hundred ninety-five years, and became the father of other sons and daughters.
verses.korean: 노아를 낳은 후 595년을 더 살면서 다른 아들딸들도 낳았어요.

verses.original: All the days of Lamech were seven hundred seventy-seven years, then he died.
verses.korean: 라멕은 모두 777살을 살다가 죽었어요.

verses.original: Noah was five hundred years old, then Noah became the father of Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.korean: 노아는 500살이 되었을 때 셈, 함, 야벳 세 아들을 낳았어요.

verses.original: When men began to multiply on the surface of the ground, and daughters were born to them,
verses.korean: 사람들이 땅 위에 많아지고 딸들도 태어났어요.

verses.original: God's sons saw that men's daughters were beautiful, and they took any that they wanted for themselves as wives.
verses.korean: 하나님의 아들들이 사람의 딸들이 예쁜 것을 보고, 마음에 드는 여자를 아내로 삼았어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said, "My Spirit will not strive with man forever, because he also is flesh; so his days will be one hundred twenty years."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "내 영이 영원히 사람과 함께하지 않을 것이다. 사람은 육체일 뿐이니 수명을 120년으로 정하겠다."

verses.original: The Nephilim were in the earth in those days, and also after that, when God's sons came in to men's daughters and had children with them. Those were the mighty men who were of old, men of renown.
verses.korean: 그 시대에 땅에는 네피림(거인들)이 있었어요. 하나님의 아들들과 사람의 딸들 사이에서 태어난 자녀들은 옛날의 유명한 용사들이었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh saw that the wickedness of man was great in the earth, and that every imagination of the thoughts of man's heart was continually only evil.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 보시니 사람들의 악함이 땅에 가득했어요. 사람들의 마음속 생각이 언제나 나쁜 것뿐이었어요.

verses.original: Yahweh was sorry that he had made man on the earth, and it grieved him in his heart.
verses.korean: 하나님께서는 사람을 만드신 것을 후회하시고 마음 아파하셨어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said, "I will destroy man whom I have created from the surface of the ground—man, along with animals, creeping things, and birds of the sky—for I am sorry that I have made them."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 말씀하셨어요. "내가 만든 사람을 땅에서 없애 버리겠다. 사람뿐 아니라 짐승과 기어 다니는 것과 새까지 다 없애겠다. 그들을 만든 것이 후회되기 때문이다."

verses.original: But Noah found favor in Yahweh's eyes.
verses.korean: 하지만 노아만은 하나님께 사랑받았어요.

verses.original: This is the history of the generations of Noah: Noah was a righteous man, blameless among the people of his time. Noah walked with God.
verses.korean: 이것은 노아에 대한 이야기예요. 노아는 그 시대 사람들 중에서 바르고 흠이 없는 사람이었어요. 노아는 하나님과 함께 살았어요.

verses.original: Noah became the father of three sons: Shem, Ham, and Japheth.
verses.korean: 노아에게는 셈, 함, 야벳 세 아들이 있었어요.

verses.original: The earth was corrupt before God, and the earth was filled with violence.
verses.korean: 그때 땅은 하나님 보시기에 타락했고, 온 땅에 폭력이 가득했어요.

verses.original: God saw the earth, and saw that it was corrupt, for all flesh had corrupted their way on the earth.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 땅을 보시니, 모든 생물이 나쁜 길로 갔기 때문에 땅이 타락해 있었어요.

verses.original: God said to Noah, "I will bring an end to all flesh, for the earth is filled with violence through them. Behold, I will destroy them and the earth.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아에게 말씀하셨어요. "모든 생물을 끝내려고 한다. 그들 때문에 땅에 폭력이 가득하기 때문이다. 그들을 땅과 함께 없애 버리겠다.

verses.original: Make a ship of gopher wood. You shall make rooms in the ship, and shall seal it inside and outside with pitch.
verses.korean: 너는 잣나무로 배를 만들어라. 배 안에 방들을 만들고, 안팎에 역청을 발라라.

verses.original: This is how you shall make it. The length of the ship shall be three hundred cubits, its width fifty cubits, and its height thirty cubits.
verses.korean: 이렇게 만들어라. 배의 길이는 300규빗(약 135미터), 너비는 50규빗(약 22미터), 높이는 30규빗(약 13미터)으로 해라.

verses.original: You shall make a roof in the ship, and you shall finish it to a cubit upward. You shall set the door of the ship in its side. You shall make it with lower, second, and third levels.
verses.korean: 배에 지붕을 만들고, 위로 1규빗(약 45센티미터) 정도 남겨라. 배의 옆면에 문을 내고, 1층, 2층, 3층으로 만들어라.

verses.original: I, even I, will bring the flood of waters on this earth, to destroy all flesh having the breath of life from under the sky. Everything that is in the earth will die.
verses.korean: 보아라, 내가 땅 위에 홍수를 일으켜서 숨 쉬는 모든 생물을 없앨 것이다. 땅 위에 있는 모든 것이 죽을 것이다.

verses.original: But I will establish my covenant with you. You shall come into the ship, you, your sons, your wife, and your sons' wives with you.
verses.korean: 하지만 너와는 약속을 세우겠다. 너와 네 아들들, 네 아내, 그리고 며느리들이 함께 배에 들어가라.

verses.original: Of every living thing of all flesh, you shall bring two of every sort into the ship, to keep them alive with you. They shall be male and female.
verses.korean: 모든 생물을 암컷과 수컷으로 한 쌍씩 배에 데리고 들어가서 살려 두어라.

verses.original: Of the birds after their kind, of the livestock after their kind, of every creeping thing of the ground after its kind, two of every sort will come to you, to keep them alive.
verses.korean: 새도 종류대로, 짐승도 종류대로, 기어 다니는 것도 종류대로 두 마리씩 네게 올 것이니 살려 두어라.

verses.original: Take with you some of all food that is eaten, and gather it to yourself; and it will be for food for you, and for them."
verses.korean: 먹을 수 있는 모든 음식을 모아서 가져가라. 그것이 너와 동물들의 먹이가 될 것이다."

verses.original: Thus Noah did. He did all that God commanded him.
verses.korean: 노아는 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 다 했어요.

verses.original: Yahweh said to Noah, "Come with all of your household into the ship, for I have seen your righteousness before me in this generation."
verses.korean: 하나님께서 노아에게 말씀하셨어요. "네 가족을 모두 데리고 배에 들어가라. 이 시대에 네가 나 앞에서 바르게 살았기 때문이다."

verses.original: You shall take seven pairs of every clean animal with you, the male and his female. Of the animals that are not clean, take two, the male and his female.
verses.korean: "정결한 동물은 암수 일곱 쌍씩 데려가고, 정결하지 않은 동물은 암수 한 쌍씩 데려가라."

verses.original: Also of the birds of the sky, seven and seven, male and female, to keep seed alive on the surface of all the earth.
verses.korean: "하늘의 새들도 암수 일곱 쌍씩 데려가서 온 땅에 생명이 이어지도록 하여라."

verses.original: In seven days, I will cause it to rain on the earth for forty days and forty nights. I will destroy every living thing that I have made from the surface of the ground."
verses.korean: "7일 후에 내가 40일 동안 밤낮으로 비를 내릴 것이다. 내가 만든 모든 생물을 땅에서 없애 버릴 것이다."

verses.original: Noah did everything that Yahweh commanded him.
verses.korean: 노아는 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 다 했어요.

verses.original: Noah was six hundred years old when the flood of waters came on the earth.
verses.korean: 홍수가 땅에 쏟아졌을 때, 노아는 600살이었어요.

verses.original: Noah went into the ship with his sons, his wife, and his sons' wives, because of the floodwaters.
verses.korean: 노아는 홍수를 피해 아들들과 아내, 며느리들과 함께 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Clean animals, unclean animals, birds, and everything that creeps on the ground
verses.korean: 정결한 동물과 정결하지 않은 동물, 새와 땅에 기어 다니는 것들이

verses.original: went by pairs to Noah into the ship, male and female, as God commanded Noah.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 암수 한 쌍씩 노아에게 와서 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: After the seven days, the floodwaters came on the earth.
verses.korean: 7일이 지나자 홍수가 땅에 쏟아졌어요.

verses.original: In the six hundredth year of Noah's life, in the second month, on the seventeenth day of the month, on that day all the fountains of the great deep burst open, and the sky's windows opened.
verses.korean: 노아가 600살 되던 해 2월 17일에, 땅 밑의 모든 샘이 터지고 하늘의 창문이 열렸어요.

verses.original: It rained on the earth forty days and forty nights.
verses.korean: 40일 동안 밤낮으로 비가 땅에 쏟아졌어요.

verses.original: In the same day Noah, and Shem, Ham, and Japheth—the sons of Noah—and Noah's wife and the three wives of his sons with them, entered into the ship—
verses.korean: 바로 그날 노아와 그의 아들들 셈, 함, 야벳, 그리고 노아의 아내와 세 며느리가 함께 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: they, and every animal after its kind, all the livestock after their kind, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth after its kind, and every bird after its kind, every bird of every sort.
verses.korean: 온갖 짐승과 가축, 땅에 기어 다니는 것, 그리고 모든 종류의 새들도 함께 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Pairs from all flesh with the breath of life in them went into the ship to Noah.
verses.korean: 숨 쉬는 모든 생물이 한 쌍씩 노아에게 와서 배에 들어갔어요.

verses.original: Those who went in, went in male and female of all flesh, as God commanded him; then Yahweh shut him in.
verses.korean: 하나님께서 명령하신 대로 모든 생물이 암수로 들어갔어요. 그리고 하나님께서 배의 문을 닫아 주셨어요.

verses.original: The flood was forty days on the earth. The waters increased, and lifted up the ship, and it was lifted up above the earth.
verses.korean: 40일 동안 홍수가 계속되었어요. 물이 점점 불어나서 배가 땅 위로 떠올랐어요.

verses.original: The waters rose, and increased greatly on the earth; and the ship floated on the surface of the waters.
verses.korean: 물이 점점 더 많이 불어나서 배가 물 위에 둥둥 떠다녔어요.

verses.original: The waters rose very high on the earth. All the high mountains that were under the whole sky were covered.
verses.korean: 물이 땅 위에 아주 높이 올라와서 하늘 아래 모든 높은 산들이 물에 잠겼어요.

verses.original: The waters rose fifteen cubits higher, and the mountains were covered.
verses.korean: 물이 산보다 15규빗(약 7미터) 더 높이 올라와서 산들이 완전히 잠겼어요.

verses.original: All flesh died that moved on the earth, including birds, livestock, animals, every creeping thing that creeps on the earth, and every man.
verses.korean: 땅 위에서 움직이던 모든 것이 죽었어요. 새, 가축, 짐승, 기어 다니는 것, 그리고 모든 사람이 죽었어요.

verses.original: All on the dry land, in whose nostrils was the breath of the spirit of life, died.
verses.korean: 코로 숨 쉬며 육지에 살던 모든 것이 죽었어요.

verses.original: Every living thing was destroyed that was on the surface of the ground, including man, livestock, creeping things, and birds of the sky. They were destroyed from the earth. Only Noah was left, and those who were with him in the ship.
verses.korean: 땅 위에 있던 모든 생물이 사라졌어요. 사람, 가축, 기어 다니는 것, 하늘의 새들까지 다 없어졌어요. 오직 노아와 배에 함께 있던 것들만 살아남았어요.

verses.original: The waters flooded the earth one hundred fifty days.
verses.korean: 물이 150일 동안 땅을 덮고 있었어요.
